questions.qText: Can reflection result in plane polarised light if the light is incident on the interface from the side with higher refractive index?
qOptions: Thus, polarization by reflection shall not definitely occur.
Thus, polarization by refraction shall definitely occur.
Thus, polarization by refraction shall not definitely occur.
Thus, polarization by reflection shall definitely occur.

qOptions: transmitted light is partially polarized with intensity \(I_0/2\).
transmitted light is completely polarized with intensity less than \(I_0/2\).

questions.qText: A ray of light in air is incident on a glass plate at polarising angle of incidence. It suffers a deviation of \(22^\circ\) on entering glass. The angle of polarization is

When light is incident on a glass block at polarizing angle a) reflected ray is plane polarized b) reflected and refracted rays are perpendicular c) reflected and refracted rays are partially polarized d) refracted ray is partially polarised
qOptions: a, c and d are correct
a, b and d are correct
b, c and d are correct
a, b and c are correct
